Package magellan.library.gamebinding

Class AbstractOrderParser.StringChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • magellan.library.gamebinding.AbstractOrderParser.StringChecker
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EresseaOrderParser.DefaultReader.DefaultChecker, EresseaOrderParser.ZaubereReader.ZaubereSpruchChecker

    AbstractOrderParser
    protected class AbstractOrderParser.StringChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    The StringChecker class may serve as a utility template for checking string tokens

    • Constructor Detail

      • StringChecker

        public StringChecker​(boolean forceQuotes,
                     boolean preferQuotes,
                     boolean allowQuotes,
                     boolean allowEmpty)
        Creates a StringChecker with default behaviour.
        Parameters:
        forceQuotes - if this is true, the string must be enclosed in (single or double) quotes.
        preferQuotes - if this is true, quotes are inserted by order completers.
        allowQuotes - if this is true, the string may be enclosed in (single or double) quotes.
        allowEmpty - if this is true, the content may be empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if forceQuotes but not allowQuote or if allowEmpty but not allowQuotes.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public boolean read​(OrderToken token)
        Tries to parse a string beginning with token. It first splits the following string tokens into openingToken, innerToken, closingToken, and nextToken (token after the string). Then it checks them with checkInner(), clears completions, calls checkNext(). If there is a completer and the last token of the string is followed by space, it calls complete(). The completions are then garnished with quotes as specified by the do... methods.
        Returns:
        checkInner() && checkNext()
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If !isString(token)
        See Also:
        AbstractOrderParser.getString(OrderToken)

      • isComplete

        protected boolean isComplete()
        If this returns true, the completer is called. In this implementation this is the case if the last string token is not followed by space and the completer is not null.

      • isQuotesValid

        protected boolean isQuotesValid()
        Checks the quotes. According to constructor parameters. Subclasses usually don't need to overwrite this method.
        Returns:
        false if there are no quotes but quotes are forced or if the closing quote doesn't match the opening quote.

      • checkInner

        protected boolean checkInner()
        Subclasses may override this method if they want to check the content, which is in innerToken.
        See Also:
        AbstractOrderParser.getString(OrderToken)

      • complete

        protected void complete()
        Subclasses should call an appropriate method of getCompleter() here.

      • checkNext

        protected boolean checkNext()
        Returns AbstractOrderParser.checkFinal(OrderToken). Subclasses should overwrite to check the rest of the order.
